page.title: 13The Water Cascade
page.content: On Friday November 30th 1984 Mayor Stan Williams,dressed in his red robes,cut a tape across the Market Place and the water feature was then formally switched on by its designer,Peter Rarstone. It was designed exclusively for Nuneaton and is the first of its kind in the world. The designer used reconstituted stone from the Empire Stone Company and he says it is a sculpture which uses two materials - stone and water.It took 12 months to construct and cost Â£30000. Despite being known locally as the 'fountain',the water flows in ever increasing cascades (rather noisely) from upturned shell shaped dishes. This nearly completes the work on the new pedestrian town centre.
